tidy_ae_table

tidy_ae_table.Rd

This function is used to obtain AE information ready for visualization

tidy_ae_table(
  population_from,
  observation_from,
  population_where = "ITTFL=='Y'",
  observation_where = NULL,
  treatment_var = "TRTA",
  treatment_order = unique(population_from[[treatment_var]]),
  ae_var = ae_var,
  ae_interested = NULL,
  stratum_var = NULL,
  listing_interested = define_ae_listing()
)

Arguments

population_from

A data frame to obtain population level variables.Typically an 'adsl' dataset.
observation_from

A data frame to obtain observation level variables.
population_where

A character string to define the criteria to select analysis population.
observation_where

A character string to define the criteria to select analysis observation.
treatment_var

A character string to define the variable of new column called "treatment"
treatment_order

A character vector to define the treatment display order and label.
ae_var

A character string to define the variable of new column called ae
ae_interested

An object returned by function define_ae_select_list()
stratum_var

A character string to define the variable of baseline stratum in 'population_from'.Only one 'stratum_var' is allowed.
listing_interested

An objected return by function define_ae_listing()

Value

Return a standard adverse event data frame

Examples

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
db <- tidy_ae_table(population_from  = adsl %>% rename(TRTA = TRT01A),
                    observation_from = adae,
                    population_where = NULL,
                    observation_where = NULL,
                    treatment_var = "TRTA",
                    treatment_order = c("MK9999" = "Xanomeline High Dose", "Placebo" = "Placebo"),
                    ae_var = "AEDECOD",
                    ae_interested = define_ae_select_list(
                             ae_criterion = c('AESER == "Y"', 'AEREL != "NONE"'),
                             ae_label = c("with serious adverse events",
                                          "with drug-related adverse events")),
                    listing_interested = define_ae_listing(listing_var = c("USUBJID", "SEX", "RACE", "AGE"),
                                                           listing_label = c("ID", "Gender", "Race", "Age")))
#> Joining, by = c("treatment", "stratum")
#> Joining, by = c("treatment", "stratum")
#> Joining, by = c("treatment", "stratum")
